data.lyric:
[ti:Sixteen]
[ar:Thomas Rhett]
[al:Life Changes]
[by:]
[offset:0]
[00:00.00]Sixteen - Thomas Rhett
[00:07.30]Written by：Thomas Rhett/Sean Douglas/Joe Spargur
[00:14.60]Take a left here boy take it slow
[00:18.15]
[00:19.10]Don't get distracted by that radio
[00:22.53]
[00:23.56]I just rolled my eyes and I said
[00:25.33]
[00:25.87]Daddy I know
[00:27.00]
[00:27.53]I'm fifteen I ain't green like some ol' ten year old
[00:31.59]
[00:32.59]What I wouldn't give to be sixteen wild and free
[00:37.07]Cruisin' up and down main in my F 150
[00:41.50]Roll the windows down bass too loud
[00:43.71]From this burnt CD
[00:46.08]I'll be right where I wanna be when I'm sixteen
[00:48.84]Sixteen yeah
[00:50.41]
[00:53.43]Sixteen
[00:55.14]
[00:59.50]Now that I can drive finally feel alive but I got this curfew
[01:03.92]Sneakin' in late smelling like my girlfriend's perfume
[01:08.41]People talk about college and knowledge and that's alright
[01:12.56]But all I'm thinkin' 'bout is an unsupervised Saturday night
[01:17.45]What I wouldn't give to be eighteen wild and free
[01:21.95]Buzzin' off a can of the grizzly wintergreen
[01:26.45]Lookin' old enough to pull off this fake ID
[01:30.91]I'll be right where I wanna be
[01:32.60]When I'm eighteen
[01:33.90]Eighteen yeah
[01:35.52]
[01:38.26]Eighteen yeah
[01:39.96]
[01:44.00]I'm old enough to smoke
[01:45.45]
[01:46.24]I'm old enough to vote
[01:48.19]But they turn me away when I go to the Cotton Eyed Joe
[01:52.64]They say the grass is always greener
[01:55.17]And I believe that's right
[01:57.23]But my friends are off to Vegas
[01:58.87]
[01:59.40]They're leavin' me behind
[02:02.52]
[02:04.57]What I wouldn't give to be twenty one wild and free
[02:09.11]Open up a cold one and drink it legally
[02:13.50]Chase a bunch of girls go see the world
[02:15.61]Let my wild streak run
[02:18.03]I'll be right where I wanna be
[02:19.59]When I'm twenty one twenty one
[02:21.80]
[02:24.28]Woah when I'm twenty one
[02:27.85]
[02:28.92]Yeah when I'm twenty one it'll be alright
[02:33.23]
[02:33.81]Yeah it'll be alright when I'm twenty one
[02:37.07]
[02:40.48]Now I'm twenty five and I'm drinkin' wine with my wife at home
[02:44.92]Got a couple of dogs and a couple songs on the radio
[02:48.56]
[02:49.32]And we sit around and we laugh about how we used to be
[02:54.06]When all we cared about was turning sixteen
data.trans:
[ti:Sixteen]
[ar:Thomas Rhett]
[al:Life Changes]
[by:]
[offset:0]
[00:00.00]//
[00:07.30]//
[00:14.60]小子 过来这里 别急
[00:18.15]
[00:19.10]别因电台播放的音乐而分心
[00:22.53]
[00:23.56]我只是翻了个白眼 说道
[00:25.33]
[00:25.87]爹地 我知道啦
[00:27.00]
[00:27.53]那时我十五岁 不再像十岁时那样稚嫩
[00:31.59]
[00:32.59]十六岁时我不愿失去 与生俱来的野性与自由
[00:37.07]可以驾着我的F-150跑车自由驰骋于街道
[00:41.50]摇下我的车窗 音响开到最大
[00:43.71]热歌循环播放
[00:46.08]当我十六岁时 我会奔赴我向往的远方
[00:48.84]十六岁啊
[00:50.41]
[00:53.43]十六岁啊 多么美好
[00:55.14]
[00:59.50]现在我终于可以肆意驰骋 感到无比自由 却被父母宵禁在家
[01:03.92]偷偷外出 深夜悄悄溜进家门 闻起来就像是女朋友身上的香水味
[01:08.41]人们都在讨论着大学和收获的知识 那没什么问题
[01:12.56]但我期盼的却是一个无人监视的周六夜
[01:17.45]到了十八岁 我仍不愿失去酷爱的野性与自由
[01:21.95]一口喝尽那听醉人的冬青酒
[01:26.45]已经到了可以放心扔掉假身份证的年龄
[01:30.91]我会奔赴我向往的远方
[01:32.60]当我十八岁时
[01:33.90]十八岁
[01:35.52]
[01:38.26]十八岁 多么美好
[01:39.96]
[01:44.00]我已经到了可以吸烟的年龄
[01:45.45]
[01:46.24]也可以投出自己的选举票
[01:48.19]但我奔赴那里时 他们却把我一把轰开
[01:52.64]他们总说 得不到的看起来总是更诱人
[01:55.17]我对此深信不疑
[01:57.23]而我的朋友却一个个去了维加斯
[01:58.87]
[01:59.40]留下我一个人
[02:02.52]
[02:04.57]到了二十一岁 我仍不愿失去酷爱的野性与自由
[02:09.11]到了可以饮酒的年龄 打开一瓶冰啤 一饮而尽
[02:13.50]追着那些靓妹 闯出去看这个世界
[02:15.61]释放野性 尽情狂奔
[02:18.03]我会奔赴我向往的远方
[02:19.59]在我二十一岁时
[02:21.80]
[02:24.28]在我二十一岁时
[02:27.85]
[02:28.92]在我二十一岁时 一切都会好起来
[02:33.23]
[02:33.81]在我二十一岁时 一切都会好起来
[02:37.07]
[02:40.48]现在我二十五岁 和我的娇妻在家小酌
[02:44.92]养着一群狗 听着电台播放的歌曲
[02:48.56]
[02:49.32]我们坐在一起 对过去的一切付之一笑
[02:54.06]我们唯一在乎的是重回那不羁的十六岁
